div.pre: 2037 Strongoli (anc. Petelia), 25 km. N of (1011) Croton, Bruttium, 1880 Burial: late 3rd cent. B.C. (K) Contents: 24 AE. In a jug within a tomb Metapontum: 1 (Hera/barley ear) Brettii: 8 (2 Mars/Pallas; 3 Zeus/eagle; 2 Nike/Zeus in biga; 1 Zeus/crab) Hipponium: 1 (Zeus/amphora and cadu- ceus) Nuceria: 1 (Apollo/horse) Petelia: 8 (2 Apollo/tripod; 1 Helios/tripod; 3 Demeter/Zeus; 1 Nike/club) Mamertines: 1 (Ares/eagle) Roman Rep.: 4 (1 as; 3 sem., rev. prow) Disposition: dispersed Fiorelli, NSc 1881, p. 67 Two Rep. AR (Syd. 461; 1052/3) and of Antoninus Pius (rev. Victory), which are also listed, are presumably intru- sive
